Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery globular aryballos; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting possibly of confronting some kind of bird and panther (of bird, neck and part of wing remaining, with added red on neck; of panther, part of face, shoulder, chest and leg; red on chest and shoulder); incised splinter rosettes as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 62, pl. 50, no. 218)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 217)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.283) (phase 3)
